alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Coastal Wakulla; Inland Franklin; Inland Wakulla; Leon; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 11:37AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wakulla, southeastern Liberty, southern Leon and northeastern Franklin Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1137 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles north of Carrabelle to 9 miles south of St. Marks. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... St. Marks, Crawfordville, Woodville, Wakulla, Sopchoppy, Newport, East Camp, Jewel Fire Tower, Shadeville, Brown House, Leon Sinks, Wakulla Springs, Hosford, Eight Mile Pond, Panacea, Clio, Poplar Camp, Smith Creek, Medart and Buckhorn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
